translation.ko: 놀라울 만큼 다양한 활동을 그림으로 남겼어요

translation.en: [Nermeen] We have multiple scenes of daily life…

translation.en: they wanted to have a fabulous afterlife,
translation.ko: 사후 세계도 멋지게 살고 싶어 했어요

translation.en: and the best way was to have a very nice tomb.
translation.ko: 가장 좋은 방법은 무덤을 멋지게 꾸미는 거였죠

translation.en: They would build tomb chapels, which were above ground.

translation.ko: 수직 갱도를 만들어 지하 침소에 연결한 후 "묘실"

translation.en: where you're actually buried.

so your soul can reanimate it.

translation.en: that they wished to enjoy for eternity.
And also, you have things called "false doors,"

And so, one part of your soul could go into the afterworld.
translation.ko: 그렇게 해서 영혼의 반은 사후 세계로 가고

translation.ko: 누군가 할 얘기가 있어서 오면 들을 수 있도록 했어요

translation.en: [Salima] So, this whole tomb complex acted as a kind of resurrection machine

translation.en: that guaranteed being able to safely go from this world to the next world

translation.en: and to sort of live this fabulous existence for eternity.

translation.en: …and he believed that he could take all this with him.

translation.en: So he spent his whole life preparing for the next life.

translation.en: But to get there,

translation.ko: 지하 세계에서 여러 시험을 거쳐야만 했어요

translation.en: The most important of these tests took place in the hall of judgment

translation.en: before Osiris, god of death and resurrection.
To get to paradise, the person had to stand in front of 42 judges

translation.ko: 특정한 죄들을 짓지 않았음을 맹세해야 합니다

translation.en: …and so on.
After that came "the weighing of the heart,"
translation.ko: 그걸 거치고 나면 심장 무게를 측정합니다

translation.en: where the person's heart was weighed against the feather of truth and justice.
translation.ko: 진실과 정의의 깃털과 망자의 심장을 저울질하죠

translation.en: If the heart was heavier than the feather,

translation.ko: 악어 머리 형상을 한 악마의 먹이가 되고

translation.en: and the person was lost forever.
But if the heart and feather were in balance,

and the journey to the Field of Reeds could begin.
Okay, same time tomorrow, boss?

translation.en: But it's in very good shape for what one would expect after about 2,500 years.

It's really very big.

-[men speaking Arabic] -[Mustafa] Do you understand?
-Then let's go! -[men speaking Arabic]

You stay here.

translation.en: [in English] As a part of my job, Secretary General,

What's in there?

translation.ko: 나무 관 안에서 미라가 발견될 때도 있어요

Maybe the ancient Egyptians made the coffin, but there's nothing in there.

translation.en: [Waziri, in Arabic] Slowly, slowly.
Mummification is about trying to preserve your image as yourself.

[Mohammad] It looks like it's burnt.
What the Egyptians would do is stick something up your nose,

translation.en: and then they would make a cut on the left side

They'd take out your liver, your lungs, your stomach, and your intestines.
So, after all of these internal organs have been removed,
translation.ko: 이렇게 내부 장기를 모두 제거한 다음에는

translation.en: you'd be dried using natron,

translation.ko: 미라를 만들 때 쓴 나트론 때문일 수도 있어요

translation.en: [Sabry] So some sort of…
-chemical reaction has occurred? -[man speaking Arabic]
[Salima] And then, they would start to wrap you using linen bandages…
-A female, I think. -[Mohammad] A female.
[Salima, in English] …and reciting spells and praying and burning incense.
translation.ko: 그리고 주문을 외우고 기도하고 향을 피우죠

translation.en: The bottom half isn't as badly affected, but it's good linen.

translation.en: [in English] And all of this, what it did was transform you from a secular creature

translation.en: to a sacred being.
translation.ko: 세속의 존재를 신성한 존재로 바꾸는 것이죠

translation.en: That would be the end of it for your life on earth.
[Salima] It would be the start of your life in the afterworld.
[Hamada] Mummifying the body is said to have been influenced

translation.ko: 고대 이집트인이 죽은 자를 대하는 방식에 심오한 영향을 끼쳤죠

Osiris was ruling the world

…and cut him into pieces that were spread across the lands of Egypt.
translation.ko: 세트는 오시리스를 산산조각내 이집트 전역에 뿌리죠

translation.en: Isis was a magician.
She went around Egypt collecting his pieces,
translation.ko: 이집트 땅을 떠돌며 오시리스의 시신을 수습해

translation.en: binding them together with linen in the first act of mummification.
translation.ko: 아마포로 감쌌던 게 미라 만들기의 시작이었습니다

translation.en: Through this, she brought him back to life

Horus grew up to avenge his father's murder

Osiris became king of the underworld

That conviction in the power of mummification to transcend death…

translation.en: was right at the heart of ancient Egyptian belief.

Usually, these shafts with these measurements go deeper,

Only 60 centimeters deep. -[Mustafa] Hmm. -[Ahmed] That's it.

translation.en: It's not just mindless digging, no.

A novice will end up breaking the thing.
Mahmoud!

Yes, and I have a big reward for you!
[Ghareeb] Fine.

About three centimeters of something wood.
[Hamada] What I can see now is…
there's a lid.
-It's a great feeling… -[man speaks Arabic]

translation.en: So it'll be impossible to get it out in one piece.

translation.en: [Ahmed] No, it'll come out intact.
That's impossible! Get that block on the left first.
-[Ahmed] That one? -[Mohammad] To make room.
Yes, yes.
I told you not to touch that.
[Hamada] I didn't touch anything. I didn't even come close!
translation.ko: 제가 손댄 게 아니에요 건드리지도 않았다고요!

translation.en: Look, in front of him, it's like a concrete wall.

translation.en: It was compressed after it filled in the space.
-[Hamada] It's solid, boss. -[speaks Arabic]
The coffin is full of mud and it's packed tight.

translation.en: -And there's a skeleton inside! -[Mohammad] Thank God!
[Hamada] I'll collect the bones.
Unbelievable…
We've been waiting a long time to know anything about him.
translation.ko: 이 사람에 대해 뭐라도 알아내려고 오랫동안 기다렸는데

translation.en: Pass the wood up.
[Mohammad] Look, only 32 centimeters.
It must be for a young child.
[Hamada] Hey, Doctor!
-[Hamada] Check this out. -[Mohammad] A molar.
[Hamada] Working at the site,
it's a naturally morbid place.
[Mohammad] They're teeth.
-[Hamada] You're in the world of the dead. -[Mohammad] It's even rotten.
translation.ko: 죽은 자들의 세계에 있으니까요 썩기까지 했네요

translation.en: [Hamada] Child burials in particular.
I mean, my heart breaks when I see the remains of a child.

translation.en: -They're molars, but they're very small. -[Mustafa] How old?

translation.en: [Mohammad] More like 14, 15… something like that.
We thought that it is a child.
But not just one.
It is more than one child.
We collect all these bones,

translation.ko: 인류학자에게 자문을 구해요 유골을 조사하러 여기까지 온 분이죠

translation.en: [Amira] Every piece of bone can tell you something.
translation.ko: 모든 뼈가 우리에게 무언가를 알려줄 수 있어요

translation.en: Not only the way of death.
The more interesting stories are about their lives.

translation.en: How did they live?
That's five… [speaks indistinctly]
Was he healthy? Was he happy?
Was he sad?
It can be known, just on the bones.
My name is Amira Shaheen. I'm a professor of rheumatology
in Faculty of Medicine, Cairo University.
And I work here to examine the bones
which are found in the different expeditions.
I'm going to spread this one, and then I'm going to study their pieces.
When Dr. Sabry asked me to come,
he told me there are small bones for children.
How many, we don't know.
That's it.
It's important we find, um, the number of persons,
translation.ko: 이게 몇 명인지 밝히는 게 중요해요

translation.en: and we want to know the common traits or the different features of the bones.
translation.ko: 유골에서 공통적인 특질이나 차이점을 찾아낼 겁니다

translation.en: First of all, I say, "As-salamu alaykum."
I feel that I'm coming, introducing myself to someone who is sitting in front of me.
translation.ko: 내 앞에 있는 분을 만나서 저를 소개하는 기분이 들어요

translation.en: Even if he is, or she is, in pieces.
translation.ko: 비록 그 사람은 유골 조각만 남았지만요

translation.en: These small pieces, this is, um…
It's the same way that I approach a… a friend.
This is the right humerus, so I should put it here.
I don't know how to get feelings from bones,
translation.ko: 제가 어떻게 뼈에서 느낌을 받는지 모르겠지만

translation.en: but I can feel it. You can feel it.
And this is the right clavicle of one of them.
The shaft nearest the door had the bones of two teenage children.
translation.ko: 문에서 가장 가까운 갱도에 10대 아이 두 명의 뼈가 있었어요

translation.en: We have this sacrum, and the other one which is large,
translation.ko: 이건 엉치뼈예요 또 다른 뼈는 크기가 커요

translation.en: and both are still not un-united, not… [speaks indistinctly]
One of them was younger than 20,
and the other one was… most were younger than 18.
By comparing the size of bones,
I think these bones are the… the one with… [inhales sharply] 18 to 20.
Yes, and this… this is the younger one.
translation.ko: 네, 그리고 이게 어린 사망자의 뼈예요

translation.en: And there were pieces of bone,
most probably related to a younger person, maybe below six years old.
translation.ko: 대부분은 어린 사람의 뼈였어요 6살도 안 될 겁니다

translation.en: Cervical…
On the first one.
I find in one box, which contains three skeletons,
we have a strange situation of this family,
with the death of three of their children at the same time.
[in English] What happened here?
[Mohammad, in English] According to the reliefs in the tomb,
we have Wahtye, and his mother, and his wife, and his four children.
translation.ko: 와흐티에, 어머니, 아내 네 자녀가 있었던 걸로 보여요

to reveal the face of Wahtye.
